alert.note: Alert for Clay (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 4:59PM EST until February 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Oneida affecting Clay County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Oneida. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Low lying areas flood, several feet of water cover the track area behind the Oneida Baptist Institute, and water is across the road in front of Town Market. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 28.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.7 feet this evening. - Action stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by midnight tonight.
